name: Muri Beach Hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I wasn't going to write a review as I didn't want this place to get so well known but Pauline (whom owners the small beach front resort) is one of the most amazing Hotelier's I have ever meet! Pauline has built a small complex of beautifully appointed bungalows right on one of the the most beautiful lagoons in the world.
reviews.title: Pauline's Bungalows Rock the Island with service, views, peace and beautiful bungalows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the beach front bungalow and it had everything I needed, lovely, modern interior, beach views and clean (as the rest of the property). Pauline throws a wonderful dinner for all those staying and is a wonderful mixer with very cool clients. Arriving from the States you get ina some crazy 6am in the morning - the bungalow was ready and full with fresh fruit, coffee and everything you need not to go out. Her staff is fantastic and friendly and made the stay very comfortable.
reviews.title: The Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Muri beach Hideaway took me to place (as with the Cook Islands) that I was like "This rocks so much more than Mexico or anywhere else I go to the beach from the US". The views from the bungalow are amazing - fantastic restaurant's just 2min stroll down the beach. Stores the same short walk. Muri has the most epicurean stores if you need a bakery hit etc.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pauline's bungalows are so great we are going back in July! Stay here i you want beauty, friendly relaxed service and chilled vacation experience.
reviews.title: Little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thank you Pauline!
reviews.title: Don't stay at hillside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were looking for the South Seas Experience, I had never been before and wanted to snorkle, relax and enjoy the location. We found The Muri Beah Hideaway on Trip Advisor and had seen the pictures of the bungalows. They were everything we' hoped for..
reviews.title: Just what we hoped for and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very private, we were the only ones there for the first three days.
reviews.title: Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities were amazing, considering there were only five bungalows. The bungalows had large covered front porches, equipped kitchen, and large bed/seating area. The pool, lagoon side deck and easy steps to white sand - we could either walk out and snorkle or use one of the kayaks and paddle out to an island . We loved walking to the bakery next door, picking up croissants to go with our fresh fruit from the property and eating breakfast on the porch - even if it was raining - it was always warm.
reviews.title: I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to walk to almost everything we needed - in the eight days we were there we only rented a bike for one day and a car for another. The bus stop is just up the road from the Hideaway.
reviews.title: Enjoyable and wonderful location

likes.liked: — Close to the beautiful lagoon and a very large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pauline was always ready to help with umbrella (we did have those tropical rains on a few days), reservations, and information about the island. She fixed an incredible meal for those of us who were there on Saturday night -- it was a treat.
reviews.title: A little gem

likes.disliked: — Location of path in front of deck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a bit of rest and recuperation following a monthin New Zealand and to prepare us for the last leg of our holiday in the USA. We (2 couples) actually stayed in the hillside bungalows which are a 5 minute walk down a paved lane to the main road and the sea. The bungalow was well appointed and VERY quite at night although we did get an early morning call from the local cockerels! We had full access to the small complex on the beach where Pauline (the owner) made us very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. The beach complex is in an excellent position and only a short stroll along the beach to the restaurants for a spot of lunch or an evening meal. Self catering is not easy on the island as the nearby small stores dont carry much in the way of fresh food so apart from breakfast we ate in the local restarants. All in all a very well equipped site with free use of snorkels,flippers and kayaks made our stay here a delight and I would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Personal touch makes all the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put, these gorgeously quaint, spacious, private bungalows are on the exact same small beach as the $500/night resorts, with the added benefit of Pauline's personal touch. You can walk to the restaurants at the resorts just a few steps down the beach, and still enjoy free snorkel gear and sea kayaks at Muri Beach Hideaway. Pauline hosts a potluck once a week, a great opportunity to meet other travellers and sample some local home-cooked foods. The last night of our stay, we had booked a night at an expensive resort. A huge disappointment after our experience at Muri Beach Hideaway. We would absolutely stay there again and would not waste our money on the resorts.
reviews.title: Better than the resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a little late - but better late than never!
reviews.title: Lovely, Lovely, Lovely

likes.liked: — Well appointed rooms with great views, privacy & good location.
likes.disliked: — No A/C, bathroom was hot, took brunt of winds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled solo
reviews.text: We decided on the Muri Beach Hideaway (MBH) based on the advice of other Trip Advisor members. We had previously stayed in on the Western side of Raro and this time I wanted to stay near Muri. I was looking for a swimable beach, a bit of wind to help with the heat & keep away the mozzies, privacy on our deck and close proximity to the beach. We got all of that & more.
reviews.title: Charming, personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Setting up the reservations online were a bit confusing b/c I kept asking for the absolute beachfront room & it sounded like we were getting booked in the lagoon view and then there was mix up in the calendar. However, when we arrived on the 9am flight and got to MBH we were thrilled to find that we had the absolute beachfront suit. This means that there is no one else in front of you. However, there is a small grove of trees so you only see the lagoon through the trunks, but you can walk 5 feet to your left for an uninterrupted view. The privacy was certainly there, however on the right there is a private rental unit and when people are there you can see them on their deck. It wasn't too obtrusive though.
reviews.title: Fine place, low service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just magic everything was perfect.From day one to the very last day,I go for a walk along the beach at 6 in the morning,it was so dam hot, I had a dip in the sea water,and that was warm as. Shops are very handy,walk there every day, to pick up some cold [Hieney]
reviews.title: Just Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love it. Having a nice cold Hieny one hot afternoon on the deck by the beach with my brother inlaws Austin & John, when suddenly we were drinking in the rain, and quess what the rain was warm.The Hideaway is the place to hide and have a very peaceful getaway from it all.Thanks Pauline & Graham.
reviews.title: Tropical paradise on your doorstep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Kia Manuia.
reviews.title: Stunning location but rather unfriendly service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a few nights in the hillside unit and one night in the beach front bungalow. We were lucky as we had both places to ourselves all of our stay. The beach front deck was perfect for morning sunbathing and afternoon cocktails, and the pool is just deep enough for some silly jumping & underwater photo antics! With use of the kayaks, snorkelling equipment and reef shoes, we needed nothing else to enhance our stay.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hillside units are in a beautiful setting just the right distance away from the other Muri properties and the main road. Located a little up the hill, we saw amazing sunrises over the banana trees, and could see a full sky of stars at night. It took us 5-10 minutes to walk to the main beach front accommodation, shop and restaurants. There was a resident cat (we named him Gordon after our duty free gin!) always waiting for us in the mornings and afternoons, a welcome addition to the natural surroundings!
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

description: Simple yet luxurious accommodation in the Cook Islands, our traditional Polynesian Style Bungalows are set on one of Rarotonga's most beautiful beaches Muri Beach. With soft white sand and magnificent views of Muri Lagoon we offer everything that traveller’s hope for in a tropical escape to the Cook Islands: views of the morning sun above, and the finest restaurants and experiences in Rarotonga right at your doorstep. This little retreat known as the Hideaway, is truly hidden away and a place to kick back and relax while you indulge yourself in Cook Islands culture. Spoil yourself with a swim in the outdoor swimming pool, take a stroll along Muri beach, stretch out on your patio and inhale the scents of your garden’s tropical flowers.
